page.title: 09The skies above our heads(2)
page.content: The world's airlines fly overhead in great numbers.Northbound civilian air- craft from Heathrow commonly fly over our block between 09.00 and 10.30 hrs. They are bound for the U.S.A. and Canada.They are using a route called Amber One East and are at altitudes of about 8000 feet. Southbound traffic,or its condensation trails,can be seen at 08.00 to 09.30 hrs.,and again in the late afternoon or evening.These planes pass over our block at about 12,000 feet and are descending to the stacking stations of Bovingdon or Stapleford Tawney.These planes use a route called Amber One West.The 2 routes together are known officially as the Daventry by- pass.The reason for the high concentration of aircraft over our block is the v.o.r.station south of Daventry.
